net.stemkoski.bagel

Class Physics

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.stemkoski.bagel.Physics
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlatformPhysics

    public class Physics
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to simulate change in position of an object based on velocity and acceleration; useful in games with a top-down view perspective. (For side-view perspective games, see PlatformPhysics.)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double accelerationValue
      Constant amount of acceleration, used by accelerateAtAngle(double).
      (package private) Vector2 accelerationVector
      Acceleration (rate of chance of velocity) of object.
      double decelerationValue
      Rate of speed reduction to apply when object is not accelerating.
      double maximumSpeed
      Maximum speed possible for object.
      (package private) Vector2 positionVector
      Position of object.
      (package private) Vector2 velocityVector
      Velocity (rate of change of position) of object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Physics(double accValue, double maxSpeed, double decValue)
      Initialize values used by physics simulation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accelerateAtAngle(double angleDegrees)
      Accelerate this object in the direction angleDegrees by the amount specified by accelerationValue.
      void bounceAgainst(double surfaceAngleDegrees)
      Change angle of motion assuming a collision with a flat surface inclined at an angle of surfaceAngleDegrees.
      double getMotionAngle()
      Calculate the angle of motion (in degrees) as measured from the x-axis (the vector (1,0)).
      double getSpeed()
      Calculate speed of object.
      void setMotionAngle(double angleDegrees)
      Set the angle of motion of this object.
      void setSpeed(double speed)
      Set speed of object.
      void update(double dt)
      Update the position of this object according to velocity and acceleration.

        Velocity (rate of change of position) of object.

      • accelerationValue

        public double accelerationValue
        Constant amount of acceleration, used by accelerateAtAngle(double).

        public double maximumSpeed
        Maximum speed possible for object.

        public double decelerationValue

    • Constructor Detail

      • Physics

        public Physics(double accValue,
               double maxSpeed,
               double decValue)
        Initialize values used by physics simulation. For objects traveling at constant speed, set acceleration and deceleration values to 0.
        Parameters:
        accValue - acceleration value
        maxSpeed - maximum speed
        decValue - deceleration value

    • Method Detail

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Calculate speed of object.
        Returns:
        speed of object

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)
        Set speed of object. If acceleration and deceleration values are 0, the speed will remain constant.
        Parameters:
        speed - speed of object

      • getMotionAngle

        public double getMotionAngle()
        Calculate the angle of motion (in degrees) as measured from the x-axis (the vector (1,0)). If the speed is 0, this method returns 0. Return values are in the range from -180 to +180.
        Returns:
        angle of motion of object

      • setMotionAngle

        public void setMotionAngle(double angleDegrees)
        Set the angle of motion of this object. If the speed is 0, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - angle of motion of object

      • bounceAgainst

        public void bounceAgainst(double surfaceAngleDegrees)
        Change angle of motion assuming a collision with a flat surface inclined at an angle of surfaceAngleDegrees.
        Parameters:
        surfaceAngleDegrees - inclination of surface this object has collided with

      • accelerateAtAngle

        public void accelerateAtAngle(double angleDegrees)
        Accelerate this object in the direction angleDegrees by the amount specified by accelerationValue.
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - direction of acceleration

      • update

        public void update(double dt)
        Update the position of this object according to velocity and acceleration. Deceleration is applied if no acceleration is present.
        Parameters:
        dt - elapsed time (seconds) since previous iteration of game loop (typically approximately 1/60 second)
